job_title: Instructor in Fort Smith, AR
pros: Supportive, Professional, Competent throughout Administration and Instructors.
cons: None at all in my opinion.

review_title: Their Tuition Benefit is a Lie
job_title: Administration Specialist III in Fort Smith, AR
pros: - Very nice, friendly, and professional coworkers - Food court and on-site Starbucks is nice - Good leadership - You will probably have your own office, which for some is pretty cool - The actual workload is stress-free and easy to handle.
cons: - Upper management/Recruitment will tell you in the interview that you can get a significant tuition break if you work as a full-time employee, but in reality, they will not allow you to use the tuition benefit after you have been employed. (they will not work around your class schedule and do not offer degree plans that can be completed online or through night classes. You have to be part-time to go to school, but part-time employees do not qualify for the tuition break benefit) - You have to come into work 30 minutes early for a decent parking spot during the Fall/Spring semester. Otherwise, you have to walk a significant distance to the office. (might differ depending on which college building you work at.) - Very low pay. Even for recent graduates.

job_title: Administrative Specialist III in Fort Smith, AR
pros: Good PTO benefits and 8-5 job, don't work weekends, paid holidays
cons: Can't live on this wage

job_title: Student Worker in Fort Smith, AR
pros: Awesome environment, great coworkers, really good experience
cons: Minimum wage, hour cap at 18 hours

job_title: Professor in Fort Smith, AR
pros: Pretty laid back environment that allows you contribute in the way you envision.
cons: Institution struggling with enrolments and budgets and leadership seems to lack a path forward.

job_title: Instructor in Fort Smith, AR
pros: Coworkers and managers are so helpful

job_title: Instructor in Fort Smith, AR
pros: It used to be a good place to work they are running off all the blue collar training instructors

pros:
Plenty of time off
It’s rewarding to work with students.
cons:
There is very little training in Workday. Not much training.
Department heads and Deans doesn’t make decisions.
School is at a stand still.
Poor communication.
Lots of remote teaching which is a disservice to students.
Minimum wage pays

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Fort Smith, AR
pros: I loved my time at UAFS, would 100% work there again.

job_title: Grants & Compliance Officer in Fort Smith, AR
pros: Quiet. Friendly folks. Great students.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Fort Smith, AR
pros: Wonderful Faculty, Students and Staff. Fair Benefits. Close to home.
cons: Terrible pay, no merit raises.

job_title: Assistant Professor in Fort Smith, AR
pros: Small class size, less tuition, less living cost

job_title: Assistant Director of Plant Operations in Fort Smith, AR
pros: Nice Atmosphere to work in

job_title: Instructor in Fort Smith, AR
pros: It is a stable place to work
cons: Promotion is difficult and there are no cost of living raises.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fort Smith, AR
pros: The state is supporting the college financially in trying to invigorate the economy in the region.
cons: There has been a significant turnover in the upper levels of administration in many areas around campus with new deans every couple of years as the then dean sees greener pastures and more power to run his shop elsewhere. The Chancellor is not equiped with the skills to administer the University and is a poor personnel manager, driving his selected top management away quickly. Average tenure is likely in the 2-3 year range for top administrators, including deans.

job_title: Guest in Fort Smith, AR
pros: LOVE the students, faculty and the staff.  There are plenty of services available to students, but alas not staff and faculty.
cons: Stingy with money for staff and most faculty.  No raise in two years and in 9th year of service.  I love this job but HATE the pay.  The benefits are not bad.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fort Smith, AR
pros: Great benefits, great people, and I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE my job.
cons: I got a 14 cent raise but WAY over that in insurance spikes.  I am torn about leaving because I love the work.

job_title: Adjunct Faculty in Fort Smith, AR
pros: Great professors, faculty, and students throughout.  :)
cons: The school is in debt.  So hiring is at a stand still.

job_title: Intructor in Fort Smith, AR
pros: Beautiful grounds and facilities; has a nice, full-sized Starbuck's on campus!
cons: Very controlling management. Virtually no academic freedom for faculty and strong dictatorial managerial approach. Strict rules for dress, attendance, etc.

job_title: Assistant Professor in Fort Smith, AR
pros: Some of the students, because they were  intelligent and/or hardworking, made it worthwhile.
cons: Administration treats faculty horribly. I was subjected to years of what I can only describe as psychological torture and the higher-ups that it was perfectly normal or not their problem. When you point out that the university is engaged in illegal and immoral practices YOU become the problem .... they have a hard time with honesty and fairness ... insofar as those are even concepts in their heads.

job_title: Information Technology in Fort Smith, AR
pros: Students are usually positive, universities have a positive vibe overall, easy to get vacation time
cons: Low pay, bickering between employees, favoritism shown by management especially in hiring, sometimes there are no raises for years or very low percentage raises

job_title: IT Specialist in Fort Smith, AR
pros: Staff feel like family. Somewhat relaxed environment work that challenges and stretches you.
cons: Opportunity for advancement is not obvious.  Insurance is really expensive (although that is the case most places)

job_title: Academic Advisor in Fort Smith, AR
pros: Awesome students, busy environment, the faculty is amazing.
cons: The pay is below market value and they don’t pay enough for all the work that they ask for!
